choices.answer: Deoxyrabulose nitric acid
A molecule found in the cytoplasm of every cell.
A molecule that has two new strands after replication.
A double helix shaped molecule containing genetic info.
...is made up of three base pairs.
...contains a nitrogenous base, hexose sugar and phosphate.
...is one unit of DNA.
...codes for a particular amino acid.
...are only found in muscles.
...come in varied forms, determined by DNA base sequence.
...are long chains of amino acids that determine phenotype.
Both 2 and 3 are correct.
A short section of DNA that codes for a particular trait.
A different version of an allele.
The packaged form of DNA
Both 1 and 2 are correct.

questions.question: In monsters, fangs (F) are dominant over no fangs (f). Why are fanged monsters always FF or Ff?

choices.answer: Because a dominant allele in a genotype is always expressed.
Because a recessive allele is hidden by a dominant allele.
Because both alleles must be f to see a recessive phenotype.
All of the above are correct.
...that both parents had the same genotype.
...that the organism has a homozygous genotype.
...that the organism will always produce dominant offspring.
All of the above are correct.

questions.question: How could a breeder make sure that his dog was homozygous dominant for woolly coat (WW)?

choices.answer: Cross it with a homozygous recessive dog.
Cross it with a heterozygous dog.
Perform a test cross - any ww offspring mean heterozygous.
Both 1 and 3 are correct.

questions.question: Why could a homozygous recessive (ww) not have a homozygous dominant (WW) for a parent?

choices.answer: Because one of the parents has to have the w phenotype.
Because one of the parents has to have the ww genotype.
Because both parents have to have the w phenotype.
Because both parents must have a w allele to pass on.

questions.question: What is the difference between a Punnett Square and a Pedigree Chart?

choices.answer: A Punnett Square shows you likelihood, not actual offspring.
A Pedigree Chart shows which offspring were actually born.
A Pedigree Chart shows you genotypes, not phenotypes.
Answers 1 and 2 are correct.

questions.question: In a Punnett Square for tongue rollers (R), where Rr is crossed with Rr, the ratios are:

choices.answer: Genotype = 1RR:1Rr:1rr
Phenotype = 3 rollers : 1 non-roller
Phenotype = 1RR:2Rr:1rr
Both answer 1 and 2 are correct.
The variation in genetics.
When different species have different genes.
Different genotypes for a trait in a population.
When mutations occur in somatic cells.
...occurs in the sperm and egg.
...produces gametes with half the number of chromosomes
...occurs in the gametes.
...occurs in ovaries and testicles to produce diploid cells.
...requires two parents and results in identical offspring.
...results in genetically different offspring.
...requires one parent and results in identical offspring.
...is another name for meiosis.
...crossing over and independent assortment
...mitosis
...fertilisation during asexual reproduction
All of the above.
...when sections of homologous chromosomes are exchanges.
...to create new combinations of alleles on a chromosome.
...during meiosis.
All of the above are correct.
...the random fusion of male and female gametes.
...chromosomes separating randomly during mitosis.
...chromosomes lining up in a specific order.
...chromosomes being randomly separated into gametes.
A temporary change in the DNA sequence.
When an organism grows an unexpected body part.
A permanent change in the DNA sequence.
A change in genetic material that is always inherited.
...does not contribute to genetic variation.
...is necessary for a mutation in a gamete to be passed on.
...is the fusion of a sperm and an egg to create a zygote.
Both answers 2 and 3 are correct.
Genes that make your legs look good.
Genes that result from a change in the environment.
Genes that are unlikely to be passed down to offspring.
Genes that help a species survive and so get passed on.

questions.question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of asexual reproduction?

choices.answer: Only one parent is needed so it can occur quickly.
Large numbers of offspring can be produced in a short time.
Offspring are genetically identical to parents.
Not well suited to sudden adverse environmental changes.
